page.title: 13LAW AND ORDER
page.content: In Dalmally we have a one man police station, the officer in charge at the moment is P.C. Fulton. He carries out all the normal police duties within the village and surrounding area. He works closely with policemen in Oban where there is a larger station. The police station in Dalmally is attached to the police house. It consists of an office and one cell the officer has one Land Rover at his disposal. In any village the policeman must be more involved with the community than in the town. This includes visits to the local school which in this village are much enjoyed by the pupils.
